instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message:
Some sign of water damage but not around the MCP or the SMC. ASD fails with MCP T1ND On Die sensor to high and the FAN spins high.
Anything to do with this one or just throw it away?

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: crap around u5535 or under MCP.

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Thank you Duke. Area around U5535 seems fine but does not measure right. I think I'll replace both U5535 and the surrounding capacitors. The resistors seems fine.

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Hmm, I think I found the problem now. There is a short to ground on pin 1 of U5535, even after replacement

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Not a short entirely, but I measure only 86 Ohms. A working board measures 2500 Ohms

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: [FONT=Courier]What do you think about the idea of just removing R5535 and inject 3.3v directly to U5535?[/FONT]

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: I get the same at pin 1 on U5515, are they connected somewhere or do they both come straight from the MCP?

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: I'd say that is coming from PP3V3_S0. Need to discharge that bus first before measuring, wait a while before you measure! I still say crap under MCP at the corner of ball G2, G3.

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Where is ball G2 and G3?

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Put some flux under the MCP and reflowed now. Seems I managed to destroy one of the memory slots :). It now passes ASD and boots in to OS X at normal speed, but the fan runs at high speed all the time.

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: There was no reason to reflow it, just a bit of heat and flux. I have no further ideas about this.

threads.title: 820-2879 T1ND On die temperature sensor high
threads.message: Me neither, I think i F**k this one up :), thank you
